Tutorials

  • Demos
circle_bundles
  • Quickstart
  • View page source

Quickstart

This page demonstrates a minimal end-to-end example using a classical circle bundle: the Hopf fibration \(S^3 \to S^2\).

Minimal working example

import numpy as np
import circle_bundles as cb

# Sample points on S^3
n_samples = 5000
rng = np.random.default_rng(0)
s3_points = cb.sample_sphere(n_samples, dim=3, rng=rng)

# Hopf projection S^3 -> S^2
base_points = cb.hopf_projection(s3_points)

# Build an open cover of S^2
n_landmarks = 60
s2_cover = cb.make_s2_fibonacci_star_cover(
    base_points,
    n_vertices=n_landmarks,
)

# Run the bundle pipeline
bundle = cb.build_bundle(
    s3_points,
    s2_cover,
    show=True,
)

Notes

  • The primary entry point is circle_bundles.build_bundle().

  • All downstream results are accessed via cached methods on circle_bundles.BundleResult.

  • Synthetic data generators and visualization helpers live in separate submodules (synthetic, viz, optical_flow).
